title: docs: weak_count returns one less pointer than expected

### Location
https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/rc/struct.Weak.html#method.weak_count
https://doc.rust-lang.org/src/alloc/rc.rs.html#2388

May also apply to:
https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/struct.Weak.html#method.weak_count
https://doc.rust-lang.org/src/alloc/sync.rs.html#2036

### Summary
Please clarify that `weak_count` excludes one implicit weak pointer, the one calling the function. This results in needing to check `strong_count` as well to determine whether a return of 0 is because the Rc has been dropped or simply because there is only the single weak pointer. This applies less to Arc since there is that +/- 1 uncertainty in the value returned already.
